item.title: Trump gunman’s hometown of Bethel Park reels after assassination attempt
item.description: The working-class town of about 30,000 just outside of Pittsburgh was rattled after learning the gunman came from their community, but most are hoping to put the violent episode behind them.

item.title: California's governor issues executive order for cities to clear homeless encampments
item.description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom issued an executive order Thursday urging cities to remove homeless encampments. But research shows clearing encampments doesn't reduce homelessness in the long term.

item.title: Russia sentences Russian American journalist to 6.5 years in secret trial
item.description: On the same day that a Wall Street Journal reporter was convicted of espionage, Russian American journalist Alsu Kurmasheva was sentenced to six and a half years in prison in a similar case.

item.title: Utah gets the Winter Olympics again
item.description: Utah will host the 2034 winter Olympics, an honor it first had in 2002. The announcement came on the same day the state celebrates its founding by Mormon leader Brigham Young. There are critics and memories of a 2002 bribery scandal.

item.title: The story of the church that ordains you with a few clicks online
item.description: Over 60 years ago, the Universal Life Church made it possible for anyone to become a minister and ordain a wedding. Today, weddings officiated by family and friends have become a huge part of the way Americans get married.

item.title: Travelers will no longer be able to choose open seats on Southwest Airlines flights
item.description: Southwest Airlines announced that it will drop the open seating model it's used since its founding more than 50 years ago. The airline is under pressure to boost profits.

item.title: A preview of tomorrow's unique opening of the Paris Summer Olympic Games
item.description: The Olympic games begin Friday. For the first time in the modern era, the opening ceremony won't be in a stadium. The Games will kick off with a parade through Paris in boats along the river Seine.
